_comment: Dialogue lines for prop interactions, organized by prop type

carl: A couch! Perfect for post-project napping. Creative genius needs rest, Paul.
paul: The couch was pristine once. Before Carl started using it as a canvas.
horror: There's something sticky between the cushions...

carl: Great table! Perfect surface area for layouts. And other... arrangements.
paul: A perfectly normal table. At least it was before Carl got creative.
horror: Are those scratch marks? From fingernails?

carl: I love lamps! They're like little indoor suns. Perfect for working late.
paul: The lamp still works. Surprisingly, Carl hasn't repurposed it yet.
horror: Why does the light flicker whenever Carl walks by?

carl: Books! Full of ideas. Some good, some... inspiring. Very inspiring.
paul: My book collection. Carl keeps putting weird things between the pages.
horror: One of these books is bound in something that isn't leather...

carl: So many delicious meals have been prepared here! My culinary laboratory!
paul: The kitchen counter. I try to keep it clean. TRY. Carl makes that impossible.
horror: The stains won't come out. They never come out.

carl: The fridge! Full of ingredients. Fresh ingredients. Very fresh.
paul: I'm afraid to look inside. Carl has been 'grocery shopping' again.
horror: Something in there is still moving.

carl: My culinary command center! The flavors I've discovered are unprecedented.
paul: The stove. Carl has been 'cooking' again. I don't want to know what.
horror: That's not food residue. That's not food.

carl: Sleep is so peaceful. I dream about my next project! Wonderful dreams.
paul: My bed. The only safe place. Usually. When Carl isn't nearby.
horror: Something was under here recently. It left a trail.

carl: Drawers full of possibilities! And supplies for my projects.
paul: My dresser. Carl, STAY OUT OF MY DRAWERS. Please.
horror: Why are all my socks missing their pairs?

carl: I keep my midnight snack supplies here! Very convenient.
paul: Just a nightstand. Nothing unusual. Please let it stay that way.
horror: The drawer won't close all the way. Something's blocking it.

carl: The thinking throne! Where inspiration strikes!
paul: I don't want to know what Carl has done to this.
horror: The water hasn't been that color in days.

carl: Perfect for relaxing! Or... other purposes. Multi-functional!
paul: The bathtub. Ring around the... is that a ring or a stain?
horror: The drain is clogged. With something fibrous.

carl: Treasure chest! Well, more like 'trophy' chest. My personal collection.
paul: A storage chest. Locked. Why is it locked? What has Carl put in there?
horror: It's locked. And warm to the touch.

carl: I've been saving some special items in here! Curated with care.
paul: A wooden crate. Probably full of normal things. Hopefully.
horror: Something inside is scratching to get out.

carl: Barrels are great for storage! And other things. So versatile.
paul: An old barrel. What's that smell? Carl has been storing things again.
horror: The lid is sealed shut. With wax. Red wax.

carl: Planning desk! So many plans... so many beautiful, detailed plans.
paul: My desk. I do my work here. When Carl lets me concentrate.
horror: The papers are covered in drawings. Of hands.

carl: Pillars! They hold things up. Unlike some people, Paul.
paul: A support pillar. Structurally important. Carl, don't touch it.
horror: There are grooves worn into the stone. Like claw marks.

carl: Chairs are for sitting! Or standing on. Or... creative purposes.
paul: A chair. At least this is normal. Small mercies.
horror: The seat is slightly warm. Someone was just here.

carl: Oh that? That's from my art project. Finger painting! Very expressive.
paul: CARL. What is that. What IS that. This was NOT here yesterday.
horror: It's still wet. And spreading.

carl: I needed fabric for a project! Curtains are basically just big napkins.
paul: The curtain is destroyed. Was that you, Carl? Of course it was.
horror: Something tore through this from the other side.

carl: I didn't like what it was showing me. So I fixed it! Much better now.
paul: Seven years of bad luck. As if living with Carl wasn't enough.
horror: Your reflection is still moving even though you stopped.

carl: I was feeding it! I just used... alternative nutrients. Organic!
paul: This plant died. Everything dies around Carl eventually.
horror: The soil is moving. Something is growing, but it isn't a plant.

carl: That's my special delivery! Don't worry about the smell. It's fine!
paul: I'm not opening that. I'm NOT opening that. Not again.
horror: It's humming. Boxes don't hum.

carl: Great for washing up! And washing... things... off. Very practical.
paul: The sink. At least the water still-- why is it red? CARL!
horror: Hair is growing out of the drain. Long, dark hair.

carl: One man's trash is another man's treasure! Or evidence. Depends on perspective.
paul: I don't want to know what Carl has thrown away in there.
horror: Something in there just blinked.

carl: I picked this rug! The pattern hides stains wonderfully. Very practical.
paul: A rug. It really ties the room together. Wait, what's under it?
horror: There's a lump under the rug. A large, person-shaped lump.

carl: My masterpiece! I call it 'Tuesday Afternoon'. The red is very authentic.
paul: One of Carl's paintings. I wish I could un-see it.
horror: The eyes in the painting follow you. All forty of them.

carl: Curtains are great! They keep the neighbors from seeing my projects.
paul: A curtain. Keeping the outside world blissfully unaware of Carl.
horror: There's a silhouette behind the curtain. It isn't yours.

carl: My supply cabinet! Very organized. By category and freshness date.
paul: A cabinet. Locked. Why is it locked, Carl? What's in there?
horror: Something inside is knocking. Rhythmically. Patiently.

carl: So much storage space! You can fit almost anything in here. Almost anyone.
paul: I stopped using this wardrobe after I found what Carl hid in there.
horror: The door creaks open by itself at 3 AM. Every night.

carl: Sometimes I see things on the screen. Even when it's off! Fun!
paul: The TV hasn't worked since the 'incident.' Carl broke it. Obviously.
horror: The screen is showing this room. From an angle that doesn't exist.

carl: So many ingredients! All locally sourced, if you know what I mean.
paul: Same as the fridge. I'm still afraid to look inside. Thanks, Carl.
horror: The temperature display reads 98.6 degrees. Body temperature.

carl: I love stools! Perfect height for all sorts of activities.
paul: A stool. Simple. Uncomplicated. Unlike my life with Carl.
horror: There are deep gouge marks on the legs. From something dragging it.

carl: I talk to the plants! They're great listeners. Unlike some llamas, Paul.
paul: A plant. Still alive somehow, despite Carl's 'care.'
horror: It turned toward you when you walked in. Plants don't do that.

carl: Nothing like a relaxing soak! The fizzy red ones are my favorite.
paul: The tub. I haven't used it since I found Carl's 'bath bombs.'
horror: The drain gurgles when no one is using it. Words. It gurgles words.

carl: For festive occasions! And also unfestive occasions. Very versatile!
paul: A cannon. Carl, why do you need a CANNON?
horror: It's loaded. The cannonball is warm.

carl: It hums! Like a lullaby. A loud, industrial lullaby. Very soothing.
paul: The station's backup generator. It's making a sound I don't like.
horror: The power fluctuates in a pattern. Like breathing.

carl: Pipes! The veins of the station. Carrying vital... fluids. Very important.
paul: Station piping. Something is flowing through it that isn't water.
horror: Press your ear to it. You can hear whispers.

carl: A ghost ship! I wonder if the crew is still... available. For projects.
paul: That ship shouldn't be here. That ship shouldn't EXIST.
horror: Its sails move against the wind. Lanterns flicker in empty cabins.

carl: I love lighthouses! They guide things to shore. All sorts of things.
paul: The lighthouse. Its light hasn't worked in years. Supposedly.
horror: The light turned on by itself last night. Pointing inland.

carl: Great for fishing! I catch the most interesting things here.
paul: An old dock. The wood is rotting but it looks recently used.
horror: Wet footprints lead from the water onto the dock. They don't lead away.

carl: Cozy little boat! Room for two. Barely. Perfect for buddy trips!
paul: A small rowboat. Our potential escape route. If Carl hasn't sabotaged it.
horror: There are scratch marks on the inside. Like someone tried to claw their way out.

carl: Tropical grass! It tickles. The soil is very fertile here. Very... enriched.
paul: Grass. At least something normal grows on this island. Despite Carl.
horror: The grass bends away from you as you approach. All of it.

carl: A {propType}! How delightful! Full of potential.
paul: It's a {propType}. Nothing unusual. I hope.
